skills.name: Write a direct proportion statement correctly
Write an inverse proportion statement correctly

explanations.A: Not quite, think about the symbol. t is directly proportional to, not equal to
explanations.B: Not quite, this would be inversely proportional to
explanations.C: Not quite, 1/p would mean inversely proportional to and we want directly proportional to. Also, think about the symbol as they are in proportion to each other, not equal to each other.
explanations.D: t is directly proportional to p' is written with the proportion symbol in place of an equal sign

explanations.A: Not quite, think about the symbol. p is directly proportional to, not equal to q
explanations.B: Not quite, this would be inversely proportional to
explanations.C: p is directly proportional to q' is written with the proportion symbol in place of an equal sign
explanations.D: Not quite, 1/p would mean inversely proportional to, and we want directly proportional to. Also, think about the symbol as they are in proportion to each other, not equal to each other.

explanations.A: Not quite, think about the symbol. t is directly proportional to p squared, not equal to it
explanations.B: Not quite, this would be inversely proportional to p squared
explanations.C: Not quite, 1/p² would mean inversely proportional to and we want directly proportional to. Also, think about the symbol as they are in proportion to each other, not equal to each other.
explanations.D: t is directly proportional to the square of p is written with the proportional symbol in place of an equals

explanations.A: Not quite, think about the symbol. r is directly proportional to, not equal to s³
explanations.B: Not quite, this would be r is directly proportional to s, we want s³
explanations.C: r is directly proportional to s³ is written with the proportional symbol in place of an equals
explanations.D: Not quite, 1/s³ would mean inversely proportional to and we want directly proportional to.

explanations.A: Not quite, this is t is equal to p. What symbol do we use for proportionality? Then we need the inverse of p.
explanations.B: t is inversely proportional to p is written with the proportional symbol in place of an equals and 1/p to show inversely
explanations.C: Nearly! The statement says inversely proportional to, not equal to. What symbol could you use in place of the equal sign?
explanations.D: Almost, this is for directly proportional, we want inversely proportional.

explanations.A: Not quite, this is p is equal to q, what symbol do we use for proportionality? Then we need the inverse of q
explanations.B: Almost, this is for directly proportional, we want inversely proportional
explanations.C: Nearly! Think about the symbol, they are not equal but proportional.
explanations.D: p is inversely proportional to q is written with the proportional symbol in place of an equals and 1/q to show inversely.

explanations.A: Almost, this is t is directly proportional to p squared - we want the square root of p
explanations.B: Not quite this is inversely proportional to p squared, we want directly proportional to the square root of p
explanations.C: Nearly! This is inversely proportional to, we want directly proportional to.
explanations.D: t is directly proportional (so we use the symbol not an equals) to the square root of p, so p is under the square root sign.

explanations.A: Not quite - this says r is directly proportional to s squared, we want directly proportional to the square root of s.
explanations.B: r is directly proportional (so we use the symbol not an equals) to the square root of s, so s is under the square root sign.
explanations.C: Not quite, this is inversely proportional to s squared, we need directly proportional to the square root of s
explanations.D: Almost, this is inversely proportional and we want directly proportional

explanations.A: Not quite, this is t is directly proportional to p squared. We want inversely proportional to the square root of p
explanations.B: Almost, this is inversely proportional to p squared - we want the square root of p
explanations.C: t is inversely proportional is written as 1/ In this question we want the denominator to be the square root of p
explanations.D: Nearly! This is directly proportional, we want inversely proportional.

explanations.A: Not quite, this is directly proportional and we want inversely proportional
explanations.B: Nearly! This is inversely proportional to b, we want inversely proportional to the square root of b
explanations.C: Almost! This is inversely proportional to b squared, we want the square root of b
explanations.D: a is inversely proportional is written as 1/ In this question we want the denominator to be the square root of b
